list.name: Changes
list.comment: Managed to connect orientJoints function to createJointChain - now joints a created by spawnJoints and oriented with orientJoints in createJointChain. That way orientJoints is used to set orientation immediately after the joints are created, using the input from the radio buttons. Previously I could only use orientJoints for orienting the joints, and not for creating them. Still need to take care of the 'none' radio button, right now it does nothing. Filled the comments

task.summary: Default task

Created recursive function in locators.py that checks for and removes a prefix from given string list. Recursive function was necessary, since simply recreating the list with .remove method won't work unless you use 2 for loops - one containing the strings to be removed and another one containing the original list with the items from the helping list removed. Another way would be to leave the unwanted strings out by using "not" in the condition statement

Created recursive function in locators.py that checks for and removes a prefix from given string list. Recursive function was necessary, since simply recreating the list with .remove method won't work unless you use 2 for loops - one containing the strings to be removed and another one containing the original list with the items from the helping list removed. Another way would be to leave the unwanted strings out by using "not" in the condition statement
Created function which replaces a string with another for each item in string list
Created function which replaces a string with another for each item in string list
Created function which replaces a string with another for each item in string list
This block creates a list of locators and spawns joints in their place
This block creates a list of locators and spawns joints in their place
Finally discovered a good way to compare list to dictionary keys and fetch the corresponding values in order to create new dictionary in particular order
Finally discovered a good way to compare list to dictionary keys and fetch the corresponding values in order to create new dictionary in particular order
Spawning selected joint chains from dropdown menu

Added functionality for deleting the locators corresponding to the selected list, from which joints will be spawned. Wrote correct condition check for selectJointChain(). Now, the function will execute both list of locators and list of nested lists of locators. Nested list of locators allows group of joints to be spawned, like the hand for example, which contains list for each finger. Breaking into lists is necessary, because otherwise the last joint spawned in pne list will be connected/parented to the first joint in the following joint chain.

Added functionality for deleting the locators corresponding to the selected list, from which joints will be spawned. Wrote correct condition check for selectJointChain(). Now, the function will execute both list of locators and list of nested lists of locators. Nested list of locators allows group of joints to be spawned, like the hand for example, which contains list for each finger. Breaking into lists is necessary, because otherwise the last joint spawned in pne list will be connected/parented to the first joint in the following joint chain.

Added functionality for deleting the locators corresponding to the selected list, from which joints will be spawned. Wrote correct condition check for selectJointChain(). Now, the function will execute both list of locators and list of nested lists of locators. Nested list of locators allows group of joints to be spawned, like the hand for example, which contains list for each finger. Breaking into lists is necessary, because otherwise the last joint spawned in pne list will be connected/parented to the first joint in the following joint chain.

Restructured the class completely. Now all the variable containing the data (mostly the locators positions) and the functions are contained within the class, and it's all cleaner and better structured

Added tab menu with misc functions and created 2 misc functions - displayLocalAxis and deleteAllLocators. Originally locators were deleted upon spawning the joints, but it might be useful to keep them until final joint chains are defined
Added confirmation message if locators need to be deleted when joints are created and separate function to delete all locators

I thought it might be a good idea to base the template skeleton on the UE mannequin, or at least have it as another template. In the process developed a function that renames the joints with the joint position prefix instead of suffix. Not essential for the project, but it might be useful in some situations.
Updated locators.py with the latest utility functions

Looking into orientations and rotations. Created a few more utility functions - select all joints, select hierarchy, enable scale compensation, set rotation order and align translational axis to local rotational axis. These should help to any rig setup and are related to the most important procedures for correctly creating a rig. Next, I will look into creating joints with predefined orientation

Looking into orientations and rotations. Created a few more utility functions - select all joints, select hierarchy, enable scale compensation, set rotation order and align translational axis to local rotational axis. These should help to any rig setup and are related to the most important procedures for correctly creating a rig. Next, I will look into creating joints with predefined orientation
Managed to set the orientation with the joint creation properly and parented the fingers to the arm. As it is now, the thumb still has to be rotated manually to curl in the palm
Managed to set the orientation with the joint creation properly and parented the fingers to the arm. As it is now, the thumb still has to be rotated manually to curl in the palm
Managed to set the orientation with the joint creation properly and parented the fingers to the arm. As it is now, the thumb still has to be rotated manually to curl in the palm
Cleaning up
Managed to build radio buttons interface, similar to the one in the joint creation tool and the orient joint tool.
Managed to build radio buttons interface, similar to the one in the joint creation tool and the orient joint tool.
Aligning the radio box
Created and connected radio buttons for joint creation to the main layout
Trying to connect the radio buttons interface with spawnJoints function
Working on integrating the radio buttons
Class restructuring
Class restructuring
Class restructuring
Class restructuring
Now parenting works for the hand and it doesn't mess witht the rest of the joints.

For some reason, Maya will flip the second joint in new hierarchy every time, but I have an idea how to fix it. Whenever that happens, the joint is fipped exactly 180 degrees, so perhaps I can query the hierarchy orientation and whenever there is 180 orientation, I can flip it back.
Managed to correct the filipping.
Managed to correct the flipping.

Restructured the class again by taking all static methods out of the class; created a couple of functions for parenting/unparenting the fingers for ease of use - unparenting is needed when applying new orientation, since when reorientated, the hand joint will point towards the first joint created after it, instead of following the elbow axis (I might b able to change that with 'position' in cmds.joint,which should orient the joint to world). More thorough commenting needs to be done.
Final touches for the day. Tested leg and hand with IKs, all seems fine. Will continue with proper commenting and will be looking into mirroring.

Fixed some orientation issues with secondary axis world orientation and l_hand_jnt orientation. Orientation is working properly now, but it works on all joints, instead of selection of joints. Next will work on that

Managed to set rotation order correctly for both leg and arm, or for world x and world y axis. Now when new orientation is applied, all joints are being adjusted accordingly. The code compares the position in world space of the first 2 joints to determine along which axis is the joint chain laid. Also now only selected joints are queried, instead of all of them, so joint chains now can be separately adjusted.

Managed to set rotation order correctly for both leg and arm, or for world x and world y axis. Now when new orientation is applied, all joints are being adjusted accordingly. The code compares the position in world space of the first 2 joints to determine along which axis is the joint chain laid. Also now only selected joints are queried, instead of all of them, so joint chains now can be separately adjusted. Updated main interface.

Managed to connect orientJoints function to createJointChain - now joints a created by spawnJoints and oriented with orientJoints in createJointChain. That way orientJoints is used to set orientation immediately after the joints are created, using the input from the radio buttons. Previously I could only use orientJoints for orienting the joints, and not for creating them. Still need to take care of the 'none' radio button, right now it does nothing.

Managed to connect orientJoints function to createJointChain - now joints a created by spawnJoints and oriented with orientJoints in createJointChain. That way orientJoints is used to set orientation immediately after the joints are created, using the input from the radio buttons. Previously I could only use orientJoints for orienting the joints, and not for creating them. Still need to take care of the 'none' radio button, right now it does nothing. Filled the comments

Also now only selected joints are queried, instead of all of them, so joint chains now can be separately adjusted.
